conclusion: Need to calculate the area under the velocity-time curve from 10 to 15 seconds.
Graph shows velocity as a function of time.
Find the area under the curve between t = 10 seconds and t = 15 seconds.
Approximate the area using trapezoids and rectangles.
Divide the interval into smaller segments for predictability.
Velocity at t = 10 is approximately 20 m/s, and at t = 11 is approximately 10 m/s.
Calculate area of trapezoid from t = 10 to t = 11: 15 meters.
Velocity at t = 11 is approximately 10 m/s, and at t = 12 is approximately 10 m/s.
Calculate area of rectangle from t = 11 to t = 12: 10 meters.
Velocity at t = 12 is approximately 10 m/s, and at t = 13 is approximately 10 m/s.
Calculate area of rectangle from t = 12 to t = 13: 10 meters.
Velocity at t = 13 is approximately 10 m/s, and at t = 14 is approximately 10 m/s.
Calculate area of rectangle from t = 13 to t = 14: 10 meters.
Velocity at t = 14 is approximately 10 m/s, and at t = 15 is approximately 10 m/s.
Calculate area of rectangle from t = 14 to t = 15: 10 meters.
Sum up the areas: Total area is 55 meters.
Total distance fallen is 55 meters, which is less than 75 meters.
Distance fallen during the 10 to 15 seconds interval is less than 75 meters.
